Madras high court orders written exam fo.description: MADURAI: If a public servant is appointed by way of influence or with the help of politicians, how can it be expected that such a person will serve the people, said the Madurai bench of Madras high court while directing the state chief secretary to issue guidelines to conduct written examination for appointments in last grade posts. The petitioner, P Udhayakumar, a physically challenged man, stated that after passing Class X, he had registered his name at the district employment office in Theni district during 1998. He said that though he has been waiting for the job for the past 13 years, P Sekar, who was junior-most in seniority, was appointed to the post of night watchman at the Kamayakoundanpatti panchayat union in 2011 as he was the relative of the executive officer. Hence, he moved the HC seeking to quash the appointment and appoint him as the night watchman. Justice S M Subramaniam observed that in view of the legal significance of the appointment of candidates to Group IV services, the court was inclined to suo motu implead the chief secretary of the state as a respondent for the purpose of implementing the order uniformly. The court said it is not inclined to quash the appointment of Sekar since he has been continuing in service for more than eight years and there is no sufficient evidence to quash the process of selection. However, the judge said there is concrete doubt in the mind of the court that such kind of appointments is made without following the established procedures. The judge said that postings to Group IV services and last grade services are made on favouritism and nepotism and that there are largescale allegations in respect of such appointments. He said that transparency is an elementary principle in improving the system of selection and appointment to public posts as it will minimise the possibility of favouritism and corrupt activities. “The district collectors are playing a pivotal role as they are the authority competent in their respective districts and therefore, they are dutybound to ensure that such appointments to Group IV services and last grade services are made with some sense of constitutionality,” the judge observed. Stating that the relief sought for in the present petition stands rejected, the judge directed the state chief secretary to frame guidelines to conduct the process of selection to the last grade posts including sweeper, gardener, scavenger, village assistant, noon meal organizer, assistant cook and office assistant by conducting written examinations and providing marks to the other eligibility criteria in consonance with the rules in force. “It is made clear that the interview marks to be awarded by the selection committee must be restricted to 15% of the total marks fixed for selection to the last grade posts,” he said The judge also directed the chief secretary to issue consolidated instructions regarding the selection and appointments to the post of last grade servants to all the government departments across the state and implement the established selection process uniformly to streamline the appointments under the constitutional schemes. Saying so, the court directed the registry to list the matter for reporting compliance on July 24. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Traffic hit near GRH annexe as kin of ca.description: Madurai: The family members and relatives of S Rambu, 22, who was murdered by a gang belonging to a different caste near Melur in Madurai district, staged a road blockade in front of the annexe building of Government Rajaji Hospital on Tuesday, refusing to receive the dead body from the mortuary. The protest, which started at around 10.30am, ended only at 6pm. Due to this traffic on the Panagal Road connecting Goripalayam and Sivaganga Road had to be diverted through another route. The protesters demanded the arrest of all those involved in the attack, stringent action and compensation for the victim’s family. Three more people, who sustained injuries in the attack are undergoing treatment. A few community leaders including former MLA of Usilampatti P V Kathiravan took part in the protest. Talks held by the city police led by deputy commissioner of police (law and order) V Sasi Mohan in the morning failed as they insisted that the district collector talk to them. Later, collector (in-charge) S Shantha Kumar held talks with the protesters, but they did not relent. Again, a meeting was held at his chamber in the district collectorate. The protest was finally withdrawn after assurance that all the suspects will be arrested and a solatium of Rs 2 lakh would be given. The protesters also received the body and took it to their native village, where the final rites were carried out. It maybe recalled that four people from an intermediate caste were attacked by a gang belonging to the scheduled caste community in Kodukkampatti on Sunday afternoon. Rambu and his friends, hailing from Nathapatti, Kachirayanpatti and Kodukkampatti were cruising through a street on a bike when a group of youths from the scheduled caste community stopped the vehicle. A quarrel broke out when they snatched the keys and questioned them. As the arguments turned murkier, the gang consisting of about 15 people attacked the four using wooden logs and stones. Rambu died in hospital the next day. Police officials said that the Keelavalavu police have registered a murder case and arrested 14 people so far. A posse of police personnel have been deployed at vulnerable pockets in the villages around Melur to prevent further tension. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

9 students injured in road accident.description: MADURAI: Nine school students were injured in a road accident involving a share-auto rickshaw and a truck and were hospitalized. The incident took place in Usilampatti-Peraiyur road in Madurai district on Wednesday morning. The rickshaw, in which the students were travelling, was hit by the truck coming in opposite direction. The auto rickshaw overturned as the impact and the students travelling in it were injured. Based on a complaint, a case was registered with Usilampatti police station and an inquiry was carried out. Police said that the students were from nearby villages, who were studying in Classes between IX and XII in a government school in Usilampatti. The injured students include Mahalakshmi, 17, Archana, 17, Rasika, 14, and Prakash, 13. The auto rickshaw was driven by one Praveen. tnn Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nine students injured as truck hits auto.description: MADURAI: Nine school students suffered injuries when a truck hit an autorickshaw in which they were going to their school at Usilampatti in Madurai district of Tamil Nadu on Wednesday morning. The accident happened at Rangasamipatti on the Usilampatti-Peraiyur Road. After being hit by the truck, the autorickshaw overturned. The injured students -- including Mahalakshmi, 17, Archana, 17, Rasika, 14, and Prakash, 13 – were taken to Usilampatti Government Hospital. They are studying in a government school in the area. A police officer said none of the students had suffered grievous injuries. The Usilampatti police registered a case. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. 290kg of banned plastic seized.description: MADURAI: Officials from the Madurai Corporation seized 290kg of banned plastic materials from various parts of the city on Monday. As many as 558 shops were raided and a fine of Rs 51,800 was collected from the erring shop keepers. The crackdown created a buzz among the trading community as they stopped using plastic for the time being. The activists, who welcomed the crackdown, have urged the civic body to continue the initiative. The crackdown was conducted based on the instructions from the state government to take stringent action against offenders. Officials from Madurai Corporation said that similar searches were conducted throughout the state on Monday. A higher official of the corporation said that ward-level teams have been formed to take action against the offenders. Each team is led by sanitation and health inspectors. They are monitored by sanitation officials in the zonal level. While targets have been fixed for them, regular reports are sought to keep them on their toes, he said. HC imposes Rs 10K cost on petitioner.description: Madurai: The Madurai bench of the Madras high court has imposed Rs 10,000 cost on a petitioner for suppressing the facts of the case in the public interest litigation (PIL) plea which sought for a probe into the irregularities in purchasing lab materials for government schools in the state. When the petition filed by K K Ramesh was heard on Tuesday, the state government submitted that a similar petition filed by the same petitioner was earlier dismissed by the court. The government also submitted that the petitioner had also filed a special leave petition (SLP) before the Supreme Court (SC) following the dismissal of the petition. The state further stated that the facts mentioned in the present affidavit of the petitioner are the same such as the facts in the petition which was dismissed earlier. Taking note of the submissions, the division bench of justice M Sathyanarayanan and justice B Pugalendhi dismissed the petition as SLP was pending before the SC. The judges further imposed a cost of Rs 10,000 on the petitioner for suppressing the fact regarding the pendency of SLP before the SC. They directed the petitioner to pay the cost imposed to the Siddha hospital inside the HC premises and submit a compliance report before the court on July 2. In his petition, Ramesh stated that under RMSA programme funds are distributed Rs 45,000 for all government and aided schools in the state to purchase laboratory articles and Rs 5,000 for library books every year. He said that lab materials with poor quality are purchased for only Rs 15,000 and the remaining amount is swindled by the officials since 2011. Hence, the petitioner sought direction to appoint a committee to inquire. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Plea to declare Madurai as an internatio.description: MADURAI: The Tamil Nadu Chamber of Commerce and Industry has urged the Centre to declare Madurai as an international airport as 2,54,163 international travellers used the airport between April 2018 and December 2018, while only 1,81,802 passengers flew to foreign countries through Coimbatore airport during the same period. President of the chamber, N Jegatheesan said that the number of international passengers in Madurai is higher than Coimbatore even though it had only three international services. The Coimbatore airport was already included in the Bilateral Air Services Agreement (BASA) with several other countries. International air traffic from Vijayawada airport during the same period was only 2,102, and no one departed from Tirupathi airport. However, while the central government declared Vijayawada and Tirupathi as international airports, Madurai remained a customs airport. Madurai, the second largest city in the state, is the gateway for thirteen south and central districts including Dindigul, Theni, Virudhunagar, Tirunelveli and Kanyakumari. These districts had a total population of 2,32,93,738, which is 29% of the state’s population. Every year, approximately 1.2 lakh passengers travel from Madurai and the other southern districts to Malaysia, 94,000 to Singapore, 80,000 to UAE, 68,000 to Saudi Arabia and 75,000 to Oman. Lack of direct air connectivity to many of the international destinations has been restricting the tourism development, exports and economic growth of the region. Only declaring Madurai as an international airport will help its industrial growth, he said. As of now Madurai has direct flights only to Dubai, Sri Lanka and Singapore, being operated by domestic airliners. Since Madurai is a point of call airport with Sri Lanka, Sri Lankan Airways has been operating a direct flight service between Colombo and Madurai for long. Non–inclusion of Madurai airport as point of call with other international destinations has been restraining foreign airliners such as Air Asia, Singapore Airlines, Tiger Airways, Air Arabia etc. from operating direct services to Madurai. All these airlines have applied to the central aviation ministry for permission to operate flights to Madurai. He has said that the TNCCI hoped that Prime Minister Narendra Modi would take steps to declare Madurai as a 24x7 airport to enhance the industrial, economic and tourism growth in the region. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Murder accused hacked to death in Madura.description: MADURAI: A 22-year-old man from K Pudur was hacked to death in Madurai city on Tuesday morning by a five-member gang. The murdered man has been identified as K Arumugam of Gandhipuram 6th Street. Investigations revealed that Arumugam was one of the accused in the murder of Dinesh a few months ago. Dinesh’s brother, Saravanan, and his accomplices murdered Arumugam to take revenge. A special police team arrested Arumugam a couple of days ago for possessing ganja. Since the quantity was lesser, he was released on bail. Arumugam appeared in the K Pudur police station in connection with the ganja case on Tuesday morning. As he left the station, the gang intercepted his two-wheeler and attacked him with sharp weapons. He died on the same spot. Locals caught one of the gang members, identified as R Balamurugan, 28, of Mangalakudi in K Pudur and handed him over to the police. Other gang members managed to flee. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. MLAs allege disparity in distribution of.description: Dindigul: DMK deputy general secretary and Athoor MLA I Periyasamy has alleged that the state government is showing disparity in the supply of water as many of the areas in Dindigul district are not getting enough water. Although there is water available under the Cauvery Combined Drinking Water project, it is not distributed evenly, he said. A delegation of MLAs, which includes Oddanchatram MLA R Sakkarapani, Palani MLA I P Senthilkumar and Natham MLA Andi Ambalam met Dindigul district collector Dr T G Vinay and urged him to ensure smooth supply of water across the seven assembly segments in the district. It has been a year since villages such as Pillaiyarnatham, Pithalaipatti, Ponmanthurai and blocks such as Oddanchatram and Reddiyarchatram received proper water supply. Although 7MLD of water is available in the Cauvery combined drinking water scheme, it is not diverted to these areas. The officials are not operating motors to divert water from Kovilur sump near Vedasandur, Periyasamy said. “The water distribution in Dindigul is in a mess due to the apathy of the official machinery. We have urged the collector to ensure water supply to all the areas in 15 days. Otherwise, we will not hesitate to lay pipeline and supply water by ourselves,” Periyasamy said. He said that poor people are forced to spend anywhere between Rs 10 and Rs 20 to purchase a pot of water, while the state government has turned a blind eye towards the issue. They will stage a protest by mobilizing people if the issue is not solved, he warned. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bodies of two more boys who drowned in K.description: MADURAI: The bodies of two more boys who drowned in the sea off Mandaikadu Pudur coastal village in Kanyakumari district on Sunday were retrieved on Monday night and Tuesday taking the death toll to three. On Sunday afternoon, four boys, Andrew Rakshan, 11, Sahaya Rejin, 12, Rashid, 12, and Sachin, 14, from Mandaikadu Pudur were playing with a ball on the beach when a giant wave dragged them into the sea. Fisherfolk managed to rescue Sachin and Andrew Rakshan and rush them to a nearby hospital. While Andrew survived, Sachin breathed his last soon. The two other boys, Sahaya Rejin and Rashid, could not be traced immediately, but the search continued. Colachel Marine Police along with fisherfolk searched for the boys and on Monday night, the body of Sahaya Rejin was retrieved in the sea near Chinnavilai village while that of Rashid was found near Coachel on Tuesday. The bodies were sent to the Kanyakumari government medical college and hospital for autopsy. It was only on June 12 that Thamarai Kannan, 23, an engineer from Edappadi in Salem district who came for a friend’s wedding drowned in the sea near Colachel. Thus, as many as four lives were lost in the Arabian Sea in the region in the two incidents. Secretary of South Asian Fishermen Fraternity (SAFF) Churchil said that the Colachel Marine Police should be better prepared to handle such situations. “Two boats with the marine police are faulty. They depend on the boats of fishermen for search and rescue operations,” he said. In a representation to the government, SAFF sought speedy repair works to be carried out on the two boats that have been defunct for close to a year, compensation of Rs 5 lakh each to the families of the deceased boys and reimbursing the fuel expenses incurred by the fishermen during the search for the boys. They sought appointment of fisherfolk in marine police, thereby ensuring better search and rescue. Churchil said that the majority in the current marine police force can’t swim in the sea and are solely dependent on the fisherfolk to carry out search when someone goes missing in the sea. Colachel Marine Police sources said that one of their boats is in good shape and repair works are being carried out in the boats that have been faulty for some time. “They will be put to use soon,” inspector Syrus said. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Biker\u2019s death: kin, pillion rider c.description: MADURAI: Family members of a 38-year-old man, who fell down from his bike and died later in a hospital, petitioned the Madurai district administration with a charter of demands on Monday. The city police had said that the biker T Vivekanandakumar of S Alangulam and the pillion rider A Saravanakumar, fell down while attempting to flee from police who were conducting vehicle check. However, the family members and Saravanakumar claimed that they fell down after Vivekanandakumar was hit with a baton by a policeman. In their petition, the family members put forth various demands including a government job for the victim’s spouse, registration of murder case against the police constable responsible, Rs 25 lakh compensation and departmental action against the police personnel present at the spot. Relatives and family members of Vivekanandakumar thronged the collectorate in large numbers on Monday. Vivekanandakumar was on his way home from his tyre shop in Simmakkal along with his employee, Saravanakumar. The incident took place at MGR Bridge connecting Thaikkal Street and Sellur at 11.30pm on Saturday. Police officers said that both Vivekanandakumar and Saravanakumar were under the influence of alcohol and it was recorded in the records of the Government Rajaji Hospital, where they were sent for treatment. Madurai city deputy commissioner of police (law and order) V Sasi Mohan said that a preliminary inquiry has been conducted with the police team involved in the vehicle check. There was no eyewitness to the incident since it took place late at night. The CCTV footages collected from the spot are yet to be analyzed. The pillion rider is yet to be inquired by the police, he said. He said that they have to wait for the autopsy report for the details on cause of death. Meanwhile, an FIR has been registered in the Vilakkuthoon police station under IPC Sections 304 (a) – causing death by negligence and 279 – rash driving, Mohan said. Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

HC: Change communal category of NEET stu.description: Madurai: Justice R Suresh Kumar of the Madurai bench of the Madras high court has directed the authorities to change the wrongly entered communal category of a student who appeared for NEET exam from other backward class (OBC) to scheduled caste (SC).In his affidavit, M Vikram Balaji, a minor represented by his father V Maran, a resident of Periyakulam in Theni district stated that his son has completed Class XII in a private matriculation school. The school had engaged some private consultants and they inadvertently uploaded his son’s particulars as other backward class (OBC) instead of scheduled caste (SC) for NEET exam.Balaji said that his son appeared for NEET exam and the results were published on June 5. The scorecard released by the chairperson of National Testing Agency, Noida, shows that his son secured 2,95,495 in all India rank and 1,29,662 rank in OBC category. He said that if his son’s communal category is corrected to SC there is an imminent chance for him to get medical admission, if not he may miss his chance of getting admission for MBBS course.He stated that immediately after noticing the error, he sent a representation to the school authorities and the chief educational officer of Theni district, but no steps were taken. The petitioner said that as the random number for counselling is to be released any moment and the counselling will commence thereafter, it would seriously affect his son’s career if his communal category is not corrected.Hence, he prayed to the HC seeking for a direction to correct his son’s communal category as SC instead of OBC and modify his communal category rank. He also sought for a direction to keep one seat vacant under SC category till the disposal of this petition. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

MSS Wakf Board employees protest over sa.description: MADURAI: Around 90 regular teaching and non-teaching staff at MSS Wakf Board College in Madurai on Monday staged a sit-in protest within the campus alleging that they were yet to be paid salary from April. The staff claimed that their livelihood was affected due to this. “We have not been paid two months’ salary and it is also highly unlikely that we would be paid one more month’s salary as well,” a protesting staff claimed. The staff were also said to have met the Madurai joint director of collegiate education to request the salary to be credited soon. The protesters also claimed that the self-financing staff didn’t face the issue. “We were told that the salary not being paid is due to the management issues,” another protester told TOI. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

3 panchaloha idols stolen from temple.description: MADURAI: Unidentified people have stolen 3 panchaloha idols from a village temple near Manamadurai in Sivaganga district. Police said that though the idols were made up of panchaloha (alloy of five metals), the composition of the valuable metals like gold and silver were of minimum quantity and hence the worth of the idols was less than Rs 2 lakh. The theft took place at Kariamanikka Perumal temple located in Idaikattur village situated 10 km away from Manamadurai. An FIR was registered with the Manamadurai police station. The idols were donated 15 years ago. Perumal idol was measuring up to two and half feet and weighing around 50 to 60 kg, Sridevi and Boodevi idols measuring around one and half feet high were weighing around 20 kg each. Police officers said that local thieves might have stolen the idols for its metal value. Since they were not antique pieces, they cannot be sold in their original shape. Teams have been formed to trace the thieves. The police suspect local hands in the crime. Deputy superintendent of police, Manamadurai range, G Karthikeyan said since it was village temple, there was no security in place. The only protection the idols had was a steel gate. The thieves entered the sanctum sanctorum after breaking open a padlock. They should have escaped through the backside of the temple, where a river is located. The incident would have taken place on Monday night. Srinivasan, the temple priest who locked the temple on Monday evening, returned only on Tuesday evening and found the idols missing. A complaint was preferred only on Wednesday, the DSP said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

SP told to file status of cheating case.description: Madurai: The superintendent of police (SP) Trichy has been directed to file a status report on July 9 in a case where a person was arrested for cheating several women of their money on the pretext of marrying them. The direction was given by a division bench of justice M Sathyanarayanan and justice B Pugalendhi of the Madurai bench of the Madras high court on Monday. In the petition, an advocate, T Jayanthi Rani who is the managing trustee of an NGO Parents Trust based at Trichy, stated that in March this year, their trust received a serious complaint from a widowed woman who was cheated by a person though a matrimonial website. She said that the person went with different names such as Ajay, Vidhu, Vidyut, Vijayakumar, Chakravarthy and posed himself as a medical practitioner in a foreign country and got acquainted with the victim women through the matrimonial website. She noted that Ajay had received a huge sum of money from the victim on the pretext of marrying her. Later, the woman came to know that the person had cheated several other women through matrimonial websites. TNN Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Bring back activist Mugilan in 3 w.description: Madurai: Members of Mugilan Meetpu Kulu petitioned the Tuticorin district collector at the weekly grievances meeting on Monday, asking the state government and the police to take steps to produce human rights and environmental protector Mugilan before the public in less than three weeks. They took out a procession to the collectorate, when they were stopped by the police. They said that the state government and the police have deliberately delayed giving any information about the activist who went missing more than 120 days ago, while he was returning after a press meet in Chennai (on February 15). He factually presented how the police and state government planned and killed the 13 persons during the police firing in the anti-Sterlite protest on May 22, 2018. In their demands, they sought dismissal and criminal proceedings against the persons whom the activist had claimed to be the accused in the press meet on February 15. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Ambulance stationed inside Meenakshi tem.description: Madurai: The Madurai bench of the Madras high court has disposed of a public interest litigation (PIL), which sought to set up a permanent primary health centre (PHC) inside the Meenakshi Sundareswarar temple, after the state government submitted that an ambulance has been stationed on the temple premises.When the petition was taken up for hearing on Monday, the state government submitted that an ambulance has been stationed inside the temple since June 10. It further submitted that the temple administration has also planned to arrange for appropriate training for 10 of its employees regarding first aid during medical emergencies.Perusing the submissions, a division bench of justice M Sathyanarayanan and justice B Pugalendhi disposed of the petition. In his PIL, advocate G Manikandan, a resident of Karaikudi in Sivaganga district stated that several devotees from across the state visit the temple. He said that no arrangements have been made by the authorities to ensure medical assistance for the devotees visiting the temple in case of emergency.The petitioner stated that recently, a woman devotee who collapsed inside the temple died and noted that such incidents should be prevented in future.Hence, the petitioner prayed to the HC seeking to set up a permanent PHC inside the Meenakshi temple premises by appointing a senior medical officer with an ambulance with modern equipment in order to provide medical help for the devotees in case of emergencies.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Man killed in Oman, family seeks justice.description: MADURAI: Kin of a 32-year-old labourer from Kanyakumari district, who was murdered in Oman, have appealed to the governments of India and Oman to get justice by putting those responsible for the murder behind bars and to bring the body of the victim to India. The victim was identified as R Babu, 32, of Mattur Kurakudi village, and was the only son of Rajamani and Rengabai. His father died when Babu was a boy and he was raised by his mother. After schooling, he completed diploma in Air Conditioning technology and worked in Kanyakumari for a few years. In May 2015, he got a job of AC technician in Oman and obtained loans for his visa, processing fees and flight ticket with the help of Arul of the same locality. Babu worked in Salalah, Oman, and did not come home in the last four years. “He used to speak with his mother and relatives at least once a month,” his relative G Jeyasingh said. Jeyasingh said that Babu sent Rs 10,000 to Rs 12,000 a month to his mother to meet her expenses and to repay the loans he obtained to go to Oman. “A couple of weeks ago, he spoke to his maternal uncle Das – who lives close to his house in native village – and told him that he would be returning home in June,” the Jeyasingh said. Reportedly, Babu had plans to build a house in his village and also shared the same with his friend from Poovancode village in Kanyakumari district – who returned home two weeks ago. While the family was awaiting his arrival, they received a call from Arul around 2.30 pm on Monday saying Babu was murdered. The family was informed that the decomposed body of a youth with many cut injuries was found hanging in an abandoned building close to the place where Babu stayed in Oman. A person known to Babu, who was also brought to the place, confirmed that it was Babu. “We were told he was murdered on Friday and the body was spotted on Monday,” said Jeyasingh. Two labourers from north India were picked for questioning on grounds of suspicion. His kin suspect that the motive behind the murder could have been money as Babu had saved some money to build a house. The family is yet to know much about the murder, they have made an appeal to the government to bring his body back home for a proper burial. They added that the killer(s) should be caught and punished. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Dead\u2019 woman seeks old age pen.description: MADURAI: The Madurai bench of the Madras high court has directed the Kamuthi tahsildar to submit a report on a plea by an elderly woman seeking to continue distribution of old age pension (OAP) which was stopped based on false information that she was dead though she is alive. In her petition, K Sundarammal, a resident of T Vallakulam village at Kamuthi taluk in Ramanathapuram district stated that she is a destitute and does not have any legal heir to take care of her. She further stated that as she does not have any permanent job she is unable to fulfil her daily needs. In 2006, she sent a representation to the Ramanathapuram district collector seeking OAP, a scheme by the state government. She said that the officials who considered her representation started distributing OAP from November 24, 2006. However, the OAP was stopped from July 21, 2015. She noted that when she submitted a representation and approached the officials she leant that the pension was stopped as the officials received information that she was dead.Sundarammal said that it is the duty of the officials to verify the information and added that she had sent a representation in 2016 seeking to furnish her death certificate based on which her OAP was stopped. The deputy tahsildar of Kamuthi taluk though a communication dated April 15, 2016 asked her to give another representation seeking OAP. She said that though she has submitted several representations to the officials concerned, no steps were taken to distribute OAP. Hence, she approached the high court. When the petition was heard on Wednesday, justice R Suresh Kumar observed that though the petitioner was very much alive, she came to know that somebody have given false information that she was dead based on which the revenue authorities have stopped the OAP. Hence, a report by way of an affidavit or counter was sought as to what went wrong in this case on July 3. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sahitya Akademi winner asks for award ci.description: Madurai: Sahitya Akademi winner for translation (Tamil) for 2018, Yoosuf, who is popularly known by his pen name ‘Colachel’ Mu Yoosuf, has appealed to the Akademi to give him a citation for the award in Tamil instead of Hindi. He received an award for his book ‘Tirutan Maniyanpillai’, the Tamil translation of G R Indugopan’s Malayalam work—‘Manian Pillaiyuda Athma Katha’ (an autobiography).Yoosuf received the award at an event held in Agartala, Tripura on June 14. “I was given a shield and a citation. Even before I left the stage I noticed that the citation was in Hindi. I showed it to a friend of mine from the Akademi in Tamil Nadu. He asked me not to take it up with the authorities there and asked me to send an email,” Yoosuf told TOI.Making it clear that he is not against Hindi, Yoosuf said that he only wanted the citation in Tamil so that he can see his name on it. “I had to get help from someone who knew Hindi to find my name on the Hindi citation,” he said and added that he has raised this with those who were in touch with him by email for correspondence in connection with the award.Yoosuf, who is from Colachel- a fishing hamlet in Kanyakumari district, dropped out of formal schooling from primary school. His family shifted to Nagercoil town and poverty forced him to take up a job in a grocery shop. This turned out to be the turning point in his life, as he started translating old Tamil and Malayalam books and novels that landed at the shop.“I can fluently converse in Tamil and Malayalam,” said the writer, who has translated close to 30 works from Malayalam to Tamil and one from Tamil to Malayalam. With not much hope that he would get his citation translated this year, he hoped that the Akademi would consider his request and implement it in the coming years, considering the future awardees from different linguistic backgrounds.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Murder accused hacked to death.description: MADURAI: A 22-year-old youth from K Pudur, a key accused in a murder case, was hacked to death by a five-member gang in broad daylight here on Tuesday morning. The deceased has been identified as K Arumugam from Gandhipuram 6th Street. He was murdered while returning home after registering his signature at the K Pudur police station in connection with the case. He was a key accused in the murder of one Dinesh and was released from prison only recently under condition bail. As he left the station a gang intercepted Arumugam’s two-wheeler and attacked him using sharp weapons. While he tried to escape and took to his heels, he was chased down and murdered. Arumugam died on the spot. One of the gangsters was caught by the public and handed over to police. He was identified as R Balamurugan, 28, from Mangalakudi in K Pudur. Investigation revealed that the murder plan was hatched by Saravanan, brother of Dinesh. Based on a complaint, a case was registered with the K Pudur police station. A search is on four more people involved in the murder. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Wife of biker who died in \u2018baton at.description: MADURAI: V Gajapriya, wife of T Vivekanandakumar, who died after falling off his two-wheeler, allegedly after a policeman hit him using a baton, attempted suicide at her house on Monday night. She was rushed to the Government Rajaji Hospital (GRH). Hospital sources said that the woman was kept under ventilator support and her condition was stated to be critical. Gajapriya, who has a one-and-a-half-year-old child petitioned the Madurai district administration on Monday along with her relatives, seeking action against the police personnel involved in the attack. The relatives had sought compensation, government job for Gajapriya and departmental action against the police personnel. In this backdrop, Gajapriya hanged herself at her house in S Alangulam, but was rescued and rushed to hospital. Meanwhile, the relatives continued their protest for the third day on Tuesday and refused to receive his body till action was initiated. The state human rights commission, which took the issue as suo moto, sent a notice to the Madurai city police commissioner S Davidson Devasirvatham to send a report on the death within two weeks time. It maybe recalled that Vivekanandakumar suffered injuries in the incident that took place late on Saturday night and died at the GRH on Sunday. The city police stated that he fell down from his bike, while fleeing on seeing the police team which was conducting a vehicular check, but, his relatives claimed that he fell down after being hit by a policeman using his baton. The relatives also claimed that the police did not take efforts to provide him treatment as he was lying down for nearly 30 minutes. A Saravanakumar, pillion rider of the vehicle, who suffered injuries in the incident, also said that they fell down after being hit by the police. Police officers said that both were in an inebriated condition and it was recorded in the medical records at GRH. An FIR was registered with the Vilakkuthoon police station under IPC sections 304 (a)- causing death by negligence, 279 - rash driving and 337- causing hurt by act endangering life or personnel safety of others. An inquiry with police personnel involved in the vehicle check is underway. They are also in the process of analysing the CCTV footages retrieved from the spot, said a police officer. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Activist seeks post in child welfare pan.description: Madurai: A social activist from Madurai district has petitioned Madurai district administration seeking appointment as a member of Child Welfare Committee (CWC) as two of the members selected for the recently formed committee did not join. While the district administration had called for fresh applications to fill the vacancies, B Pandiarajan, a social activist has urged to consider him since he was already in the recommended list by the selection panel. B Pandiarajan, has extensively worked for the dalit rights and children education, in the capacity as a member of district vigilance committee, and is a full-time social activist. The new five-member CWC was constituted last year after a selection process, which started in 2015. The two vacancies have arisen after J Venkatarathinam, a government school teacher and one C Sam Jeffrey Srinivasan did not join. Recently, an official from the social defence department had informed that Pandiarajan was not selected for the committee since he was part of a couple of committees. Pandiarajan stated that they were only honorary membership and require only a few sittings in a year. “When a government teacher with a full-time job was appointed, why not full time social worker?,” he questioned. He stated that section 18 (2) of the juvenile justice act says that the vacancy of a member can be filled from the panel of names in the order of preference as recommended earlier by the selection committee. Moreover, the Madurai bench of Madras high court also recently ruled in a case filed by Pandiarajan that if the petitioner has been earlier recommended by the selection committee, he of course will have a preference as per JJ act rules. But the court order too is not implemented, he stated in his petition. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Youth attacked in clash succumbs to inju.description: Madurai: A 22-year-old youth, who suffered injuries in an attack by a 15-member group, died in a hospital on Monday. Three more people who were injured in the incident that took place on Sunday, are undergoing treatment in hospital. The deceased was identified as S Rambu of A Kovilpatti village near Nathapatti in Madurai district. The injured were identified as P Subash, 19, and P Thangaiah, 30, from Kodukkampatti, R Dhivakar, 19, from Kachirayanpatti. While the deceased and injured belong to an intermediate caste, the attackers hailed from a scheduled caste community. Police sources said that both the accused and the injured were under the influence of alcohol. The attack took place on Sunday afternoon at Kodukkampatti due to a sudden provocation between the two groups. Rambu and his friends visited Kodukkampatti village, where his relatives reside, to attend a temple festival. They went to a shop located in the scheduled caste people’s residential area. As they sped through the locality on a two-wheeler, a group of people from the scheduled caste community warned them against rash riding in their area. This resulted in a heated argument. A group of around 15 people the attacked the four using wooden logs and stones, which left them badly injured. Rambu, who suffered grievous injuries, was first taken to a hospital in Singampunari, from where he was referred to the Government Rajaji Hospital, where he died on Monday. The relatives of the victim and the injured staged a protest at Panagal Road in front of the GRH. While an autopsy was conducted, the relatives refused to receive the body. Meanwhile, the Keelavalavu police registered a case under various sections of the IPC including 302- punishment for murder. While 15 people including 10 unnamed have been booked, M Ravichandran, 19, B Kalyanasundaram, 27, Natchiappan,34, T Thirumavalavan and K Kalanjiyam from Kodukkampatti have been picked up for inquiry. A large posse of police have been deployed in villages around Melur to prevent caste-based clash and reduce tension in the village, where the incident took place. South Zone IG K P Shanmuga Rajeswaran and deputy inspector general of police (Madurai range) Pradip Kumar visited the village and took stock of situation. Madurai district superintendent of police was camped at Melur. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Cops survey student dropouts to halt cri.description: MADURAI: As schools and colleges reopened after summer break, the city police have begun a survey to find out the number of students who have not turned up yet, and their present status. The exercise is being carried out to ensure that students who discontinue studies without much thought are brought back, by talking to their parents. Since mostly teenagers and youths involve in criminal activities in Madurai city, the police believe that such a survey and counselling can prevent them from joining hands with anti-social elements. The dropouts are lured by gangs into engaging in minor offences before they go on to become hardened criminals. Youngsters’ involvement in crime activities has been a cause of concern for the city police. First-time offenders mostly involve in crimes like snatching, which has been a big challenge for the city police. City police commissioner S Davidson Devasirvatham told TOI that the list of dropouts is expected to be made available in a month. Dropouts from classes VIII to XII as well as those from colleges also will be targeted. “We will check what the dropouts do now and efforts will be taken to put them back in schools and colleges. We will talk to their parents to make sure they continue their education,” he said. Police officers from the city police unit say that minors involve in all sorts of crime starting from theft, robbery and chain snatching to murder. The youths, who are aimless in life, gang up and start committing minor offences before becoming notorious elements. “Such youths are supplied addictive stuff such as liquor and ganja. Once they become loyal, they are used to observe movements of their targets. After their involvement in a few crimes, they go for ghastly acts such as murder. Many also get murdered in the rivalry between gangs,” said a police officer. After getting caught and landing in prison, they require money towards legal expenses to come out of the prison. When they come out they cannot get employed and are forced to commit another offence to find money to pay for the legal expense. Over time, this has become a vicious cycle. Hence it is important to wean them out of the criminal activities, another officer said. He added that “it is the duty of the parents to closely monitor the behavioural changes in their wards. With both parents working to keep the family afloat, they would not be effectively monitoring their children. “Most of the parents wake up only after a point where it is difficult to wean them out,” an officer said. Ramdas Athawale.description: NEW DELHI: Union minister and Republican Party of India leader Ramdas Athawale on Wednesday left members of the Lok Sabha, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in peels of laughter with his witty remarks, some aimed at Congress president Rahul Gandhi. In his congratulatory remarks after the unanimous election of Om Birla as Lok Sabha Speaker, Athawale, who has a knack for spontaneous humour, said he is happy that Rahul got a chance to sit in Lok Sabha though as an opposition member. While Rahul won from Wayanad in Kerala, he lost the Gandhi stronghold of Amethi in Uttar Pradesh to Smriti Irani. #WATCH:Ramdas Athawale in Lok Sabha says,"Rahul ji aapko wahan baithne ka mauka mila isiliye aapko badhai deta hoon… https://t.co/cRPL9IbuWV— ANI (@ANI) 1560939466000"Rahul ji aapko wahan baithne ka mauka mila isiliye aapko badhai deta hoon. Jab apki satta thi tab main aapke saath tha. Chunav ke pehle mujhe Congress wale bol rahe the idhar aao. Maine hawa ka rukh dekha ki woh Modi ji ki taraf ja rahi hai (I congratulate you on getting an opportunity to sit there (in the Opposition benches). I was with the UPA when it was in power. Congress leaders asked me to join them again ahead of elections. But I saw which way the wind was blowing and decided to remain with NDA," he said. Rahul and Sonia took his remarks sportingly and were seen smiling. When the RPI leader was speaking, Modi was seen laughing on more than two occasions. "Now, our government will run for five years, and for another five years ... Modi sahib will continue to do the good work. We will not let you come this side (treasury benches) so easily," Athawale said, amid thumping of desks by NDA members. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. City sweats it out as power cuts rise.description: MADURAI: Madurai city and its rural pockets have been experiencing unscheduled power cuts lasting up to an hour for the past few weeks but in the last two days they have stretched to over three hours in many parts of the city. While the monthly power shutdowns for maintenance works have been regular, the unscheduled ones have been causing much inconvenience to the public. “When power is suddenly disrupted, all the work comes to a standstill and working women like me are the most affected,’’ said K Shanthi of Alagappan Nagar. People say it is understandable that the state’s power situation will also be bad in the wake of the water problem, but that the power generation and distribution company (Tangedco) should at least inform them about any probable cuts in the morning or evening. ``If the power shutdowns are announced in advance, people can even schedule their work accordingly and keep inverters ready. Madurai has many small software firms that depend on regular supply for their work,’’ said K Sugumar, who has a software firm at Bibikulam. “Blackouts during the nights are also becoming regular, which is causing concern to the people. Sometimes, the street lights are not switched on for hours at a stretch when the streets remain dark. Late evening cuts could be avoided,’’ said Kalavani, a homemaker from Anna Nagar. Many parts of Mattuthavani, Thirunagar, Thiruparankundram and Iyer Bungalow have been experiencing unscheduled powercuts during night and day. The local EB office is also not very helpful during these unscheduled shutdowns and are not able to provide any details about how long the power will be off. ``They have become very unresponsive and phone calls are not answered, which makes it difficult when there are infants and elders at home,’’ said Josephine, a teacher. Tangedco sources claimed that there was no major load shedding in Madurai region as the wind season had started. ``But sometimes, the load peaks, especially in the afternoon and night. When it does not come down, it is staggered at the grid level,’’ they said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pa Ranjith\u2019s advance bail plea adjo.description: Madurai: The Madurai bench of Madras high court has adjourned the case of anticipatory bail petition moved by film director Pa Ranjith following the registration of a case against him by Thanjavur police for his controversial comment on king Rajaraja Cholan. When the petition was heard on Wednesday, Justice P Rajamanickam granted time to rectify the defects in the intervening petition filed against the anticipatory bail plea and adjourned the case to June 21. During the previous hearing, the state government had given an undertaking before the court that Ranjith will not be arrested in connection with the case till June 19. The director submitted in his petition that the prosecution’s case was that he had given a controversial speech at a public meeting convened by Neela Panpattu Maiyam at Thiruppananthal in Thanjavur district on June 5 which might promote enmity between different groups. He stated that the Thiruppananthal police have registered a case under section 153 and 153 (A)(1)(a) of IPC. The petitioner stated that he was invited to address the people on the eve of the death anniversary of T M Mani alias Umer Farook who was the founder of Neela Panpattu Maiyam. At the meeting, he said he had quoted some historical truths about king Rajaraja Cholan. He stated that the crux of his speech was as follows: “Our history has been teaching that king Rajaraja Cholan’s reign was a golden period, but according to many social reformers, his rule was a black period for the oppressed caste as most of their land was acquired by the king. Moreover, during his reign, 400 women were branded as devadasis and 26 of them were sent to Kolar Gold Field.” TNN Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Funds, NIRF rank raise demand for Alagap.description: SIVAGANGA: The demand for admissions at the Alagappa University in Karaikudi in Sivaganga district has increased significantly this academic year, with nearly 90% of seats having already been filled. Officials from the university have said that once the admission process gets over, the total student strength would increase from 5,500 last year to more than 6,000 this year. Also, sources in the university said that five new postgraduate (PG) courses would be introduced this year. Speaking to TOI, university registrar H Gurumallesh Prabu said that a Rs 100 crore sanction from the Centre under the Rashtriya Uchchatar Shiksha Abhiyaan (RUSA) scheme for an upgradation, good ranking (28) achieved in the National Institute Ranking Framework (NIRF) 2019 and increase in demand for arts and science courses helped more candidates apply to the university. “From having only 2,500 students a while back to getting it increased to around 5,500 last year and the numbers set to cross 6,000 this year shows how much the university has grown over the years. Though only one stage of admissions is over, we can already say that the demand has increased significantly this year,” he said and added that at the end of first stage of admissions itself, almost 90% of seats were filled. Meanwhile, the five postgraduate courses that are to be introduced are disaster management, politics and public administration, journalism and mass communication, fisheries science and theatre and film studies. “The courses were chosen based on the industry requirements and the potential in the future,” a senior official said.
